segments.en: And we're going to be looking at our fifth episode of our famous love story.
segments.cn: 我们将要看我们著名爱情故事的第五集。

segments.en: So if you haven't listened to the first four, I suggest you go do that first because... You're going to be a little bit lost.
segments.cn: 如果你还没听前四集，我建议你先去听，因为... 你会有点迷失。

segments.en: And so, so good that I don't think we can even say... What's going to happen next?
segments.cn: 甚至精彩到我觉得我们不能说... 接下来会发生什么？

segments.en: No, we can't say what the key language is.
segments.cn: 不，我们不能说关键语言是什么。

segments.en: Yeah, we can't preview anything because we want to surprise you.
segments.cn: 是的，我们不能预览任何内容，因为我们想给你惊喜。

segments.en: But we can tell you this.
segments.cn: 但我们可以告诉你这个。

segments.en: The last time we saw Veronica and Steven, they broke up, right?
segments.cn: 上次我们看到Veronica和Steven时，他们分手了，对吗？

segments.en: And Veronica was with her friend and feeling really terrible and then Steven suddenly came to sing a beautiful song.
segments.cn: Veronica和她的朋友在一起，感觉非常糟糕，然后Steven突然来唱了一首美丽的歌。

segments.en: So this is continuing on that.
segments.cn: 所以这就是接下来的故事。

segments.en: So let's listen to the dialogue and then we'll come back and talk about some of the difficult vocabulary we might find.
segments.cn: 那么我们来听对话，然后我们再回来讨论一些可能会遇到的难词汇。

segments.en: Honey, of course, I forgive you.
I was wrong to get upset over nothing.
segments.cn: 我因为小事生气是错的。

segments.en: I'm sorry, I haven't called or anything.
segments.cn: 对不起，我没有打电话或其他什么。

segments.en: But right after you decided you wanted a break, I was up north to put out some major forest fires.
segments.cn: 但在你决定想要休息后，我在北方扑灭一些重大森林火灾。

segments.en: I was in the middle of nowhere working day and night trying to prevent the Blaze from spreading.
segments.cn: 我在偏远地区日夜工作，试图防止火势蔓延。

segments.en: Oh, honey, I'm glad you're okay.
segments.cn: 哦，亲爱的，我很高兴你没事。

segments.en: But I have some exciting news.
segments.cn: 但我有个激动人心的消息。

segments.en: I've always wanted to be a father.
We'll go to the doctor first thing in the morning.
segments.cn: 我们明天一早去看医生。

segments.en: We have your test results back and indeed, you are pregnant.
segments.cn: 我们收到了你的测试结果，确实，你怀孕了。

segments.en: Everything seems to be in order.
Your approximate due date is October 27th, 2009.
So that means the baby was conceived on February 3rd, 2009.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着宝宝是在2009年2月3日受孕的。

segments.en: Why are you asking these questions?
I was away the first week of February at a training seminar.
segments.cn: 我在2月的第一周参加培训研讨会。

segments.en: I... I... No, it can't be.
segments.cn: 我... 我... 不，这不可能。

segments.en: All right, so more drama in our love story.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们的爱情故事又多了戏剧。

segments.en: Things were going well and now more bad news.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，现在又有坏消息。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at the vocabulary first in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们先看看词汇。

segments.en: Well, we're gonna look at four words now.
segments.cn: 我们现在要看四个单词。

segments.en: So this noun is another word for a fire, right?
segments.cn: 所以这个名词是火的另一个词，对吗？

segments.en: So basically, it's like the flame of the fire.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，它就像火焰。

segments.en: Yes, this one is a little bit difficult.
So I think we can use some examples to show us how to use this word.
segments.cn: 所以我想我们可以用一些例子来展示如何使用这个词。

segments.en: We need to evacuate these people.
We have to go in there and save those people from the Blaze.
segments.cn: 我们必须进去救那些人脱离Blaze。

segments.en: Okay, so it's clear now, Blaze.
Let's look at our next word, conceived.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个单词，conceived。

segments.en: Conceive is a nice fancy word.
Yes, and what does it mean, Marco?
Oh, like how you sidestepped around that one.
segments.cn: 哦，你绕过这个问题真巧妙。

segments.en: So it basically means to create.
segments.cn: 所以它基本上意味着创造。

segments.en: Yes, most commonly with the baby.
So after the baby was conceived, we have a due date.
segments.cn: 所以在宝宝受孕后，我们有了预产期。

segments.en: We all know that it's nine months later, approximately.
segments.cn: 我们都知道大约是九个月后。

segments.en: So the due date is the date of birth, basically.
segments.cn: 所以预产期就是出生日期，基本上。

segments.en: It's the doctor's guess when the birth would be.
When you go to the doctor and say, when will my baby be born?
segments.cn: 当你去看医生并问，我的宝宝什么时候出生？

segments.en: He'll say, well, your due date is blah, blah, blah.
And our last word and language takeaway, accurate.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个词和语言要点，准确。

segments.en: Now, the due dates aren't accurate.
That means they're not 100% sure or precise.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们并不100%确定或精确。

segments.en: So when something is accurate, it's absolutely certain.
segments.cn: 所以当某事是准确的，它是绝对确定的。

segments.en: Let's listen to some more examples of how we can use accurate.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些关于如何使用准确的例子。

segments.en: A blood test is the most accurate way of finding out if you are pregnant.
segments.cn: 血液测试是确认你是否怀孕的最准确方法。

segments.en: These reports are not accurate, John.
We checked and discovered a lot of mistakes.
segments.cn: 我们检查后发现了很多错误。

segments.en: This new software helps us calculate costs in a very accurate way.
segments.cn: 这个新软件帮助我们以非常准确的方式计算成本。

segments.en: With those examples, I think we're ready to listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 有了这些例子，我想我们准备好再听一遍这个对话了。

segments.en: This time we're going to slow it down, right?
segments.cn: 这次我们要放慢速度，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, in case you were so shocked by what happened that you couldn't follow.
segments.cn: 是的，以防你对发生的事情感到震惊而无法跟上。

segments.en: Honey, of course I forgive you.
I was wrong to get upset over nothing.
segments.cn: 我因为无事而生气是错的。

segments.en: I'm sorry I haven't called or anything.
segments.cn: 对不起，我没有打电话或其他什么。

segments.en: But right after you decided you wanted a break, I was called up north to put out some major forest fires.
segments.cn: 但就在你决定想要休息后，我被叫去北方扑灭一些重大森林火灾。

segments.en: I was in the middle of nowhere, working day and night, trying to prevent the Blaze from spreading.
segments.cn: 我在偏远地区，日夜工作，试图防止火势蔓延。

segments.en: Oh, honey, I'm glad you're okay.
segments.cn: 哦，亲爱的，我很高兴你没事。

segments.en: But I have some exciting news.
segments.cn: 但我有个激动人心的消息。

segments.en: I've always wanted to be a father.
We'll go to the doctor first thing in the morning.
segments.cn: 我们明天一早就去看医生。

segments.en: We have your test results back, and indeed, you are pregnant.
segments.cn: 我们收到了你的测试结果，确实，你怀孕了。

segments.en: Everything seems to be in order.
Your approximate new date is October 27, 2009.
segments.cn: 你的预产期大约是2009年10月27日。

segments.en: So that means the baby was conceived on February 3, 2009.
segments.cn: 这意味着宝宝是在2009年2月3日受孕的。

segments.en: Why are you asking these questions?
I was away the first week of February at a training seminar.
segments.cn: 我在2月的第一周参加培训研讨会。

segments.en: I... I... No, it can't be.
Alright, so continuing on with our drama, let's take a look at some interesting phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，继续我们的戏剧，让我们看看流利构建器中的一些有趣短语。

segments.en: Well, we've got three phrases for you.
The first one is the middle of nowhere.
This is a kind of a funny one, but I think if we listen to some examples, it will help us to understand the meaning of this phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个有点搞笑的短语，但我认为如果我们听一些例子，会帮助我们理解这个短语的意思。

segments.en: We are in the middle of nowhere.
How can we find our way back home?
segments.cn: 我们怎么能找到回家的路？

segments.en: I was in the middle of nowhere, so I couldn't even use my mobile phone.
segments.cn: 我在偏远地区，所以我甚至无法使用手机。

segments.en: It takes me two hours to drive to your house.
segments.cn: 开车到你家需要两个小时。

segments.en: It's in the middle of nowhere.
Alright, so middle of nowhere, it means that you are lost.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以偏远地区意味着你迷路了。

segments.en: Yeah, you're in a place with no cities or people or anything nearby.
segments.cn: 是的，你在一个没有城市或人或任何东西的地方。

segments.en: Okay, so just imagine yourself in a desert.
segments.cn: 好的，想象一下自己在沙漠中。

segments.en: That would be the middle of nowhere.
That would be the middle of nowhere.
Alright, let's take a look at our next phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个短语。

segments.en: So when we talk about the first thing, it means...
segments.cn: 所以当我们谈论第一件事时，它意味着……

segments.en: Really, really early in the morning.
So I can change it a little bit and say first thing in the afternoon.
segments.cn: 所以我可以稍微改变一下，说下午第一件事。
或者明天早上第一件事。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a very common way of referring to very early.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一个非常常见的方式来指代非常早。

segments.en: Yeah, it's not like first thing in the morning is like six o'clock in the morning, right?
segments.cn: 是的，早上第一件事并不是指早上六点，对吧？

segments.en: But if you say, okay, I'll take care of that first thing in the morning, you'll do it right away in the morning.
segments.cn: 但如果你说，好吧，我会在早上第一件事处理这个，你会在早上立刻去做。

segments.en: Right when you get to the office.
Okay, let's look at our last phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看最后一句话。

segments.en: Everything seems to be in order.
So this is a very common phrase when people check your documents or report.
segments.cn: 所以这是人们检查你的文件或报告时非常常见的短语。

segments.en: They'll say, okay, all the papers seem to be in order.
segments.cn: 他们会说，好的，所有文件似乎都正常。

segments.en: Good news when you're pregnant that everything seems to be in order.
segments.cn: 怀孕时，所有一切似乎正常是个好消息。

segments.en: All right, so let's listen to this dramatic dialogue one more time and we'll come back and talk some more.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再听一次这个戏剧性的对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Honey, of course I forgive you.
I was wrong to get upset over nothing.
segments.cn: 我因为小事生气是错的。

segments.en: I'm sorry I haven't called or anything.
segments.cn: 对不起，我没有打电话或其他什么。

segments.en: But right after you decided you wanted a break, I was up north to put out some major forest fires.
segments.cn: 但在你决定想要休息后，我在北方扑灭一些重大森林火灾。

segments.en: I was in the middle of nowhere working day and night trying to prevent the Blaze from spreading.
segments.cn: 我在偏远地区日夜工作，试图防止火势蔓延。

segments.en: Honey, I'm glad you're okay, but I have some exciting news.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我很高兴你没事，但我有个激动人心的消息。

segments.en: I've always wanted to be a father.
We'll go to the doctor first thing in the morning.
segments.cn: 我们明天一早去看医生。

segments.en: We have your test results back and indeed you are pregnant.
segments.cn: 我们收到了你的测试结果，确实你怀孕了。

segments.en: Everything seems to be in order.
Your approximate due date is October 27th, 2009.
segments.cn: 你的预产期大约是2009年10月27日。

segments.en: So that means the baby was conceived on February 3rd, 2009.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着宝宝是在2009年2月3日受孕的。

segments.en: Why are you asking these questions?
I was away the first week of February at a training seminar.
segments.cn: 我在2月的第一周参加培训研讨会。

segments.en: Well, Marco, what do you think about this situation?
segments.cn: 那么，Marco，你对这个情况怎么看？

segments.en: What would you do if you were this guy?
segments.cn: 如果你是这个家伙，你会怎么做？

segments.en: Uh, I don't know what I would do.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道我会怎么做。

segments.en: It seems like something very typical of soap operas.
segments.cn: 这似乎是肥皂剧中非常典型的情节。

segments.en: Well, I don't know because she didn't really deny it in the end.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道，因为她最后并没有真正否认。

segments.en: She didn't say no right away.
Yeah, but she didn't say like, oh...
Yeah, she didn't really accept it.
segments.cn: 是的，她并没有真正接受。

segments.en: So it's still a little bit difficult to see if maybe she cheated on him or something.
segments.cn: 所以很难判断她是否可能背叛了他。

segments.en: Hey guys, what do you think?
Do you think Veronica cheated on Stephen?
Do you think it's his baby?
segments.cn: 你认为这是他的孩子吗？

segments.en: Anything could happen here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 在EnglishPod这里，任何事情都有可能发生。

segments.en: So send us your ideas and tell us what do you think happens next.
segments.cn: 所以把你的想法告诉我们，告诉我们你认为接下来会发生什么。

segments.en: Come to EnglishPod.com where you can leave your questions, your comments.
segments.cn: 来到EnglishPod.com，你可以留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: Yeah, and Marco and I are always around to answer your questions, respond to your comments.
segments.cn: 是的，Marco和我总是在这里回答你的问题，回应你的评论。

segments.en: And we want to know what you think will happen next.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你认为接下来会发生什么。

segments.en: Alright guys, so until next time.
